New Records: Shreyas Iyer scored an unbeaten 74 off 44 balls, the highest score in the match.
Ravindra Jadeja contributed 45 not out off 18 balls, a key partnership in India's chase.
Key Match Events: Shreyas Iyer hit six fours and four sixes in his unbeaten 74.
Ravindra Jadeja played a crucial role in the latter part of the innings with aggressive batting.
Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka scored 75 off 53, the highest score for Sri Lanka in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka struggled in the initial overs, scoring only 15 runs in the first four overs.
India's bowlers, led by Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Jasprit Bumrah, used swing to contain Sri Lanka's openers.
Post-Match Reflections: India won the match by 7 wickets with 17 balls remaining, securing an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.
The win marked India's 11th consecutive T20I victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Dharamsala, with the surface offering some swing for the Indian bowlers.
The match saw several key player performances and strategic decisions.
Others: The result contributed to India's dominance in the series, showcasing their strong batting lineup and bowling capabilities.
